text: Allobates tinae is a frog. It lives in Brazil. ==Home== This frog is awake during the day. This frog lives on the ground in forests. People see it on the dead leaves on the ground. There are protected parks in the place where the frog lives, for example Floresta Nacional do Iquiri and Parque Estadual de Guajará-Mirím. ==Young== Scientists think this frog has young the same way most frogs in Allobates do: The female frog lays eggs on land. After the eggs hatch, the male frogs carry the tadpoles to water. Scientists have not yet written reports about seeing A. tinae frogs do this, though. ==Danger== Scientists say this frog is in danger of dying out. ==First paper== * ==References== Category:Frogs of South America
title: Allobates tinae
